Issues.Title: Decision Tree Algorithm
Issues.Body:
is this possible in ml.net ?
how can I achieve this one.  
My unanswered questioned no. 05
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Decision Tree Algorithm " (#6115)

Issues.Title: LBFGSLogisticRegression trainer probability distribution issue
Issues.Body: We are using LBFGSLogisticRegression trainer for binary classification which seem to be working fine but in some cases (especially with larger training data) probability distribution isn't even. We are getting probability of above 90 and near 0 for positive and negative test samples respectively even though scores for these samples are quite apart. Is there a way to calculate probability which will linearly scale as per scores generated by transform operation.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "LBFGSLogisticRegression trainer probability distribution issue" (#6114)

Issues.Title: Decision Tree Algorithm in ml.net  ?
Issues.Body: How I can  achieve that?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Decision Tree Algorithm in ml.net  ?" (#6113)

Issues.Title: Hierarchical Classification in ml.net ?
Issues.Body:
Is there way to achieve Hierarchical Classification in [ml.net](http://ml.net/)?
Like Predict cat from animal category and then predict breed of that cat based on cat as a input? in multiclass-classification?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Hierarchical Classification in ml.net ? " (#6109)

Issues.Title: Analysis of score given as output by binary classification algorithms
Issues.Body: Binary classification algorithm like Lbfgs, fasttree etc produce score generated by trained model for test cases but the range of score seems to be often very wide resulting in probability either showing as very close to 0 or very close to 1. Is there a way that range of the score function can be estimated before evaluating the results. Really helps with scenarios where threshold can be a variable and a custom calibration needs to be used.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Analysis of score given as output by binary classification algorithms" (#6102)

Issues.Title: How can perform percentage predication in ml.net?
Issues.Body:
I want my features percentage on targeted variable/label.
For example Movie -is my targeted variable and I want to predict genre of that movie like Romantic=99.98% Comedy=00.01% thriller=00.01
i.e.. Romantic + comedy + Thriller =100%
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How can perform percentage predication in ml.net? " (#6097)

This enables users to convert KQL and SQL kernel values to dataframe in notebooks

Issues.Title: Protobuf Parsing Failed when loading Keras model with custom layer
Issues.Body:
Hey all I'm having an error when trying to load a keras model with a custom layer. When trying to call Transforms.ApplyOnnxModel(modelFile) I'm receiving an exception:

Microsoft.ML.OnnxRuntime.OnnxRuntimeException: '[ErrorCode:InvalidProtobuf] Protobuf parsing failed.'

Has anyone tried loading models with custom layers with onnxruntime and have you had any success?

Does anyone know which ONNX opsets are supported in the current ML.NET? Or where I can find this information?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Protobuf Parsing Failed when loading Keras model with custom layer" (#6098)

Issues.Title: DataFrame enhancements
Issues.Body:
I see dozens of issues and enhancement suggestions for DataFrame in Microsoft.Data.Analysis namespace untouched for almost a year.
Are there any resources allocated to address those?
Is the project dead? 
Are there any plans to fund the work on those features in the future?
Should we base any future development on these?

Specific enhancements desired:
- Array/VBuffer column types
- Sort by multiple columns
- GroupBy by multiple columns
- Parquet read/Write (currently the [ParquetSharp.DataFrame](https://github.com/G-Research/ParquetSharp.DataFrame) has some limited support)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "DataFrame enhancements" (#6088)

Issues.Title: Fixed PFI bug with transformer chains
Issues.Body:
Fixes #6027 

The new pfi APi we added to make it easier for users has an issue with handling Transformer chains incorrectly. This PR fixes that and adds a test using Transformer chains.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fixed PFI bug with transformer chains" (#6085)
